column1: #Text=Shawnee National Forest is a big section of national forest in Southern Illinois near Carbondale .
#Text=The land it occupies was once productive and settled farmland , but erosion and unsustainable 19th-century farming practices led farming to become less viable .

#Text=In the Great Depression , Franklin Delano Roosevelt 's administration established the CCC ( Civilian Conservation Corps ) to use unemployed young men to restore environmentally degraded areas such as Southern Illinois .
#Text=The plan for the forest was that it would reverse environmental damage and bring in tourist dollars to the economically depressed surrounding area .
#Text=The forest is at the convergence of several ecological regions , so the wildlife is quite diverse .
#Text=During the Illinoisan Stage ( between 352,000 to 132,000 years ago ) , the Laurentide ice sheet covered up to 85 percent of Illinois .
#Text=The southern area of this ice sheet was located in what is now the Shawnee National Forest .
#Text=Because of this , there are tons of interesting and spectacular bluffs and overlooks located throughout the entire park .
#Text=The geologic processes that formed the landscape are partially responsible for the presence of important mineral resources , including some of national significance .
#Text=There are no fees to enter the Shawnee National Forest .
#Text=The Garden of the Gods Recreation Area has a 1/4 mile long trail that winds through a collection of rock formations perched on a Cliff .
#Text=Trail End Restaurant at Double M Campground , 5320 Thacker Hollow Rd , Junction .
#Text=April-November : M - Th 10AM - 5PM , F Sa 10AM - 6PM , Su noon-5PM .

#Text=April-November : M - Sa 10AM-5PM , Su noon-5PM ; December-March : Th - Sa 10AM - 5PM , Su noon-5PM , M - W by appointment only .
#Text=May - October : M - F noon-5PM , Sa 10AM - 7PM , Su noon-7PM ; November- April : Su - F noon-5PM , Sa noon-6PM .
#Text=There are 7 campground areas in the national forest with rates from $ 10 to $ 36 .
#Text=Primitive camping is allowed year round with no fees .

#Text=Like much of the South , in which extreme Southern Illinois resembles in some ways , there is the risk of running into a few different species of poisonous snakes : cottonmouths ( water moccasins ) , copperheads , and timber rattlers .
#Text=Be vigilant and use common sense when hiking ; some parks may well have more of a population or frequency of encounters then others .
#Text=In fact , a portion of the National Forest is closed off each year to allow for the ritual snake migrations that take place there ( protecting you and the snakes from harassment ) .
#Text=Ticks , which can carry a multitude of diseases including Lyme 's Disease , are also very common in the warmer months .
